docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to my Digital Fabrication and Modeling Documentation Website, a comprehensive record of my learning journey throughout the course. This platform captures my design decisions, technical explorations, and fabrication workflows, reflecting both conceptual understanding and hands-on practice.    The documentation is developed using MkDocs with the Material theme and is fully version-controlled with GitHub, ensuring transparency, traceability of changes, and continuous publication of updated content.  ## Professional Background  My name is NIYOMUGENGA Prosper, and I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering. I am currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Internet of Things (IoT), where my academic focus is on embedded systems, connected devices, and intelligent technologies.

docs.title: Course Documentation Overview
docs.text:
This documentation site is structured to guide you through my digital modeling and fabrication learning journey. You can navigate through:

  • Documentation Manual – Guides on setup, workflow, modeling, and fabrication
  • Daily Documentation – Daily progress logs including design decisions, screenshots, and fabrication notes
  • Reflection – Lessons learned, critical analysis, and improvements throughout the course

Each section combines text explanations, images, diagrams, and step-by-step workflows to provide a complete understanding of the design and fabrication process.

docs.title: Day 01 – Building a Documentation Website with MkDocs Material
Documenting Design & Fabrication Processes
docs.text: Digital fabrication links digital design and physical production through computer-controlled tools such as CNC machines, laser cutters, and 3D printers. It evolved from manual craft and industrial manufacturing to enable rapid prototyping, precision, iteration, and hybrid workflows, transforming fabrication into an accessible process for innovation, education, and localized production.

docs.title: 1. Objective
docs.text: The main objective of building a documentation website using MkDocs with the Material theme is to create a clear, structured, and user-friendly platform for presenting technical or project documentation.

docs.title: 2. Task Description
docs.text:
Students are required to create a documentation website using MkDocs Material to document their digital modeling and fabrication learning process.

The website should document:

  • Course understanding
  • Design decisions
  • Modeling workflow
  • Fabrication considerations
  • Reflections and outcomes

docs.title: 3. Required Pages
docs.text:
The site must include:

  • Home – course overview & student introduction
  • Digital Modeling – modeling approach, screenshots, files
  • Fabrication Logic – machines, materials, constraints
  • Prototyping & Iteration – tests, failures, improvements
  • Reflection – lessons learned & critical analysis

docs.title: 4. Developed Skills
docs.text:
Through this task, students develop the following skills:

  • Version control and collaboration using GitHub
  • Publishing open and accessible technical documentation
  • Building reproducible and transparent documentation workflows

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Digital Modeling for Fabrication refers to the process of creating accurate digital 2D or 3D models using computer-aided design (CAD) tools, specifically intended for digital fabrication technologies.

  • The digital model defines the shape, dimensions, and features of an object
  • It accounts for material properties, tolerances, joints, and assembly methods
  • The model is directly used to generate machine instructions for tools such as laser cutters, CNC routers, and 3D printers

docs.title: 1. Printable Product for Experiencing the 3D Machine
Activity 1 – FreeCAD Model
docs.text:
Design Characteristics

  • Two flat faces at 90°
  • Two circular holes for screws or bolts
  • Simple geometry with no complex curves
  • One filleted corner for safety and manufacturability

docs.title: 2. Activity 2 – Inkscape Model
docs.text:
Press-Fit Box Panel (2D Vector)

Task 1: Design Characteristics

  • A flat rectangular panel
  • Rectangular slots cut into the edges
  • Slots sized to match material thickness
  • Designed to slide and lock with other panels
  • Entirely 2D vector geometry

docs.title: 3. Modeling Approach (Inkscape) of Final Product
docs.text:
Inkscape is an open-source vector graphics design software widely used for 2D digital modeling in fabrication workflows, especially for laser cutting, vinyl cutting, and CNC engraving.

In this modeling approach, designs are created as vector paths rather than raster images, ensuring precise, scalable, and machine-readable geometry. Inkscape allows accurate control of dimensions, line thickness, colors, and layers, which are essential for defining cutting, engraving, and scoring operations.
